feedback.comment: Well-documented logger utility with clear JSDoc comments explaining purpose and usage
shouldLog() correctly checks import.meta.env.DEV to conditionally log only in development
debug/info/warn all check shouldLog() before logging; error() always logs (errors are important even in production)
Pre-configured loggers exported (tradingBotLogger, chartLogger, apiLogger, wsLogger) - good DX
Imports tradingBotLogger with clear alias 'logger' for consistent usage throughout file
fetchStatus() uses logger.error() for failures with diagnostic information
handleStart() uses logger.group() for collapsible diagnostic logging, logger.debug() for verbose info, logger.info() for key events
Error handling includes diagnostic logging with specific error messages and suggested fixes

overall_comments: TASK-010 is well implemented. The logger utility provides debug/info/warn/error levels that check import.meta.env.DEV before logging (except errors which always log). The [TradingBot] prefix is implemented via the pre-configured tradingBotLogger. TradingBot.tsx has been refactored to use the logger throughout - no raw console.log statements remain. The logger also provides useful features like group(), table(), time(), and timeEnd() for advanced debugging scenarios.
test_output: No unit tests for logger utility - consider adding in future task

acceptance_criteria_review.no_raw_console_log_in_TradingBot: PASS - All logging uses logger.* methods
acceptance_criteria_review.logs_appear_in_development: PASS - shouldLog() returns true when import.meta.env.DEV is true
acceptance_criteria_review.logs_suppressed_in_production: PASS - shouldLog() returns false when import.meta.env.DEV is false
acceptance_criteria_review.diagnostic_info_still_available: PASS - logger.debug() and logger.group() preserve diagnostic capability
